text: Sheldon "Shel" Dorf (July 5, 1933 â€“ November 3, 2009) was an American comic- strip letterer and freelance artist. He is known for being the founder of the San Diego Comic-Con International."Founder of San Diego Comic-Con dies at 76", Associated Press, 4 November 2009. Accessed 4 November 2009. Archived 4 November 2009.Spurgeon, Tom. "Shel Dorf, 1933-2009", The Comics Reporter (self-published), 4 November 2009. Accessed 4 November 2009. 4 November 2009.Evanier, Mark, "", POV Online (self published), November 3, 2009. Accessed 4 November 2009. Archived 4 November 2009. Dorf lettered the Steve Canyon comic strip for the last 12 to 14Although R.C. Harvey gives it as 12 years in the 2002 Milton Caniff: Conversations, Mark Evanier states 14 in his 2009 tribute to Dorf. years of the strip's run.Caniff, Milton and Harvey, R.C., Milton Caniff: Conversations, University Press of Mississippi, 2002, p88. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1933 births Category:2009 deaths Category:Deaths from diabetes Category:American comics artists Category:People from Detroit
